page.title: 18 Allotments.
page.content: Cross Lane allotment has been worked since 1935.There are 31 allotments now on the site but there used to be many more.The soil in this site is mainly heavy clay and it cracks easily in dry weather.The fertiliser used is mainly farmyard manure. Owners use the allotments for their own convenience,and grow vegetables fruit and flowers there instead of their own gardens.People get great satisfaction from tending allotments. Since 1971 people have come from all over Wirral to work in the allotments, but before that they had to live in Wallasey.The rent is Â£11.25 a year but pensioners pay half price.There is a long waiting list as allotmente are very popular.Damage is caused by pigeons and slugs rather than by vandalism.
